summary: This bill, the District of Columbia Judicial Nominations Reform Act, seeks to amend the District of Columbia Home Rule Act. It focuses on restructuring the judicial nomination process. Specifically, the bill aims to terminate the District of Columbia Judicial Nomination Commission, giving the President the power to designate chief judges and nominate judges. It also includes conforming amendments to update relevant sections of the D.C. Official Code. The amendments will apply to appointments made on or after the bill's enactment.
